Description: Lower wall and foot fragment of East Greek pottery cup; flaring conical foot with broad resting surface. Wholly glazed save underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.703)
Coulson 1996 / Ancient Naukratis Volume II The Survey at Naukratis and Environs (no. 1878 or1879, Fig. 47)
